intro: Anthenantia villaregalis, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, velvety leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Its fruit is a capsule that releases small seeds when mature. Anthenantia villaregalis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other regions for horticultural purposes.
